{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3117747,"name":"Javaru","username":"Javaru","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/javaru/{size}/6589_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-07T15:56:48.840Z","cooked":"

For the 2023 season, I‚Äôve released new version 3.0.1 of the (unofficial) FRC Plugin for IntelliJ IDEA . Versions 2022.1.x, 2022.2.x and 2022.3.x of IntelliJ IDEA are supported for all editions (Community, Education, and Ultimate). As of last year, I am increasing the major version number each build season for better clarity of when the plugin supports the next build season. Hence the 3.0 version.

Installation

You can install by going to File | Settings | Plugins, select the ‚ÄúMarketplace‚Äù tab, and then search for ‚ÄúFRC‚Äù. Select the ‚ÄúFRC‚Äù plugin and click the Install button. After it completes, you may need to restart IntelliJ IDEA.

To upgrade, go the File | Settings | Plugins, select the ‚ÄúInstalled‚Äù tab, then search either for ‚ÄúFRC‚Äù or for ‚Äú/outdated‚Äù. Click the ‚ÄúUpdate‚Äù button. After it completes, you may need to restart IntelliJ IDEA.

What‚Äôs New

2023 WPILib Support and Templates

I‚Äôve updated of the New FRC Project Wizard to support the 2023 templates. The Java templates are direct ports of the official WPI Lib templates, with the ability to add some enhancements such as Kotlin support, include a customized the .gitignore file (or exclude it), and more. The Kotlin templates are my conversions of the official Java templates, and are modified to be more Kotlinesque. The Kotlin files are created in src/main/java rather than src/main/kotlin so you can very easily use both Java and Kotlin code in the project, with the classes living side by side.

Creation of Run/Debug Configurations

When you use the the FRC Project Wizard within IntelliJ IDEA, it creates a series of IntelliJ IDEA Run/Debug Configurations for running the various gradle tasks to build and/or deploy the robot, and for attaching the debugger. In the past, this was the only time or way to create the run/debug configurations. As requested in this comment by @warren.parsons IntelliJ IDEA will now create the run debug configurations when adding the FRC Facet. The FRC Facet should automatically be added when opening a robot project for the first time in IntelliJ IDEA, such as one created externally. (You can also manually add the FRC Facet to the Gradle main module as described in the IntelliJ IDEA documentation.) Finally, you can add the run/debug configurations via an action from the menu: Tools | FRC | Create Run/Debug Configurations | Create Build, Deploy, and Debugging Run/Debug Configurations . Note that the configurations are saved in a .run directory in the root of the project. This directory can be stored in Git (or your version control of choice) for team sharing. Its presence will not affect VS Code users.

Previous features

RioLog Console Tool Window

While the Gradle ‚Äúriolog‚Äù task can be used to view the riolog output in the Gradle build window, the FRC Plugin provides a dedicated RioLog Console Tool Window which allows for pausing, restarting, search, and clearing of the output, either on demand or automatically upon robot restart. It also provides native supports the awesome Grep Console plugin providing you with color syntax highlighting, output folding ‚Äì so you can have those verbose debug statements folded out of view until you need them ‚Äì as well as the ability to filter out lines. (FYI, I have no affiliation with the free Grep Console plugin. I just think its a great plugin and therefore wanted to provide support for it, if for no other reason then for my own use )

image1079√ó260 28.5 KB

Command Based Robot Templates

There are several command based robot class templates to make coding easier. For example, when creating a command, you can select required subsystems:

The resultant created command will have the appropriate call to addRequirements:

image820√ó208 32.5 KB

In Commands written in Kotlin as well:

image848√ó218 24.3 KB

Run/Debug Configurations

Projects created via the new project wizard have run debug configurations generated for them. This not only makes building and deploying easier ‚Äì and accessible from all the familiar run/debug keyboard shortcuts ‚Äì but it makes debugging easier. No more digging through the docs or Chief Delphi to refresh your memory on how to configure things to attach your Robot to the debugger. Simply run the ‚ÄúBuild & Deploy Robot for Debugging‚Äù configuration, then use one of the ‚ÄúDebug Robot‚Äù debugger tasks (depending on how you are connected to the robot) to attach IntelliJ IDEA‚Äôs debugger.

You can also access the gradle based run/debug configurations from the Gradle tool window:

You can, as of 2023, also create these run/debug configurations via the menu: Tools | FRC | Create Run/Debug Configurations | Create Build, Deploy, and Debugging Run/Debug Configurations.

Theses run/debug configurations are stored in a .run directory in the root of the project to allow sharing via git. It you do share via git, when updating the project in another instance of IntelliJ IDEA, they may not get recognized and added to the UI immediately. Closing the project and reopening will result in their discovery. (This is a core IntelliJ IDEA feature and the delay of them being recognized is out of my hands.)

Automatic notifications of WPILib Updates Available

When a WPILib update is available, the FRC Plugin will provide a notification to you. And with one click, your gradle build file will be updated to the new version, and your project re-imported (i.e. sync‚Äôed).

The check for update can also be run manually from the Tool menu:

Feedback Welcome

As always, I sincerely appreciate any feedback you have. Please let me know if you are finding the plugin worthwhile by commenting below, or giving it a quick 5 star rating, or leaving a review. Also please feel free to open any feature requests, or report any issue via the Project‚Äôs Issue Tracker . I have a few more minor tweaks I hope to get done and pushed out soon before my Software Mentoring duties become my main focus for Q1.

Good luck to all the teams this year. I hope this plugin helps you to develop your robot with pleasure.

I tried out using intellij for programming a week or two ago and it worked great (though the plugin wasn‚Äôt supported because I didn‚Äôt update intellij but that‚Äôs fixed now) but now it will not build the code at all, throwing this error

A problem occurred configuring root project ‚Äòrobot-2023‚Äô.
Could not resolve all files for configuration ‚Äò:classpath‚Äô.
Could not resolve edu.wpi.first:GradleRIO:2023.4.2.
Required by:
project : > edu.wpi.first.GradleRIO:edu.wpi.first.GradleRIO.gradle.plugin:2023.4.2
No matching variant of edu.wpi.first:GradleRIO:2023.4.2 was found. The consumer was configured to find a runtime of a library compatible with Java 8, packaged as a jar, and its dependencies declared externally, as well as attribute ‚Äòorg.gradle.plugin.api-version‚Äô with value ‚Äò7.5.1‚Äô but:
- Variant ‚ÄòapiElements‚Äô capability edu.wpi.first:GradleRIO:2023.4.2 declares a library, packaged as a jar, and its dependencies declared externally:
- Incompatible because this component declares an API of a component compatible with Java 11 and the consumer needed a runtime of a component compatible with Java 8
- Other compatible attribute:
- Doesn‚Äôt say anything about org.gradle.plugin.api-version (required ‚Äò7.5.1‚Äô)
- Variant ‚ÄòruntimeElements‚Äô capability edu.wpi.first:GradleRIO:2023.4.2 declares a runtime of a library, packaged as a jar, and its dependencies declared externally:
- Incompatible because this component declares a component compatible with Java 11 and the consumer needed a component compatible with Java 8
- Other compatible attribute:
- Doesn‚Äôt say anything about org.gradle.plugin.api-version (required ‚Äò7.5.1‚Äô)>

everything works fine when I use vscode so it isn‚Äôt an error with the project. Any ideas?

Edit: so apparently I hadn‚Äôt set the java version correctly so it was trying to use java 8 instead of a newer version‚Ä¶ I thought I had set that right but no no lol.

Hey @dan, I‚Äôve opened a feature request for your ask. I‚Äôll see what I can do. I can‚Äôt make any promises, especially for this coming competition season. I sadly just don‚Äôt have as much time to work on the plugin as I‚Äôd like. And I have some other pressing feature requests and issues to address. But I might be able to get something basic in for this season and then enhance it in the future. But again, no promises.

Dave1998:

Is there an ETA for 2024 project generation support?

I‚Äôm working on that now as we speak. I hope to have it done today. But it may bleed into tomorrow and/or Thursday. It then takes up to 2 business days for the plugin to clear screening. So hopefully it will be available before this weekend, but more likely next week Tuesday or Wednesday if not due to the holiday on Monday.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2023-12-27T21:58:50.687Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":142,"readers_count":141,"score":33.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":421018,"topic_slug":"intellij-idea-frc-plugin-update-released-for-2023-season","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51921,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3100 alum (old prog lead)"},"post_url":"/t/intellij-idea-frc-plugin-update-released-for-2023-season/421018/10","custom_user_title":"3100 alum (old prog lead)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3269644,"name":"Javaru","username":"Javaru","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/javaru/{size}/6589_2.png","created_at":"2023-12-27T23:12:46.339Z","cooked":"
SammyPants:

it would crash in intellij.

As someone that‚Äôs used IntelliJ IDEA daily for work for 21 years ‚Äì and having spent a lot of time in the forums over that 21 years ‚Äì I can tell you that it‚Äôs pretty rare for IntelliJ IDEA to out right crash. It has really good exception handling that will catch almost all issues. If it does crash, it is usually a sign of a corrupt file. Either in the project or the IntelliJ IDEA installation. So I‚Äôd try it on a fresh project (i.e. re-clone it from git, or create a new one) and/or reinstalling IntelliJ IDEA. You can also take a look at the logs (Help > Show Log in Explorer) and see if it reveals anything. Finally, while I can‚Äôt see a corrupt index crashing IntelliJ IDEA, I suppose anything is possible. So try invalidating the caches (File > Invalidate Caches‚Ä¶).

Hi @Tatiman-Dev , can you be more specific? I just published an update this past Monday that fixed a few minor things, including a potential corner case issue in the Gradle build file for a Kotlin Robot. But I‚Äôm not aware of anything specific to a problem with the Kotlin Command template. If you can let me know the specifics here, or open a bug report, I‚Äôd be happy to get it fixed ASAP. I love Kotlin and want to see more teams using it. So anything I can do to help with that is a priority for me. Thanks.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T17:52:21.281Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":97,"readers_count":96,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":421018,"topic_slug":"intellij-idea-frc-plugin-update-released-for-2023-season","display_username":"Javaru","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://gitlab.com/Javaru/frc-intellij-idea-plugin/-/issues","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Issues ¬∑ Mark / IntelliJ IDEA FRC Plugin ¬∑ GitLab","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19841,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"IntelliJ IDEA FRC Plugin Author"},"post_url":"/t/intellij-idea-frc-plugin-update-released-for-2023-season/421018/16","custom_user_title":"IntelliJ IDEA FRC Plugin Author","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3354130,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T18:33:26.231Z","cooked":"

Unfortunately I‚Äôm unable to use GitLab (It says my email exists but refuses to send me a password reset) So I can‚Äôt submit a bug report.

The problem is very simple, in the default RobotContainer.kt object, drivercontroller‚Äôs intitialization is placed below the call of configureBindings, this causes the robot code to crash as it tries to access driver controller before it‚Äôs created.

 init
    {
        configureBindings()
        // Reference the Autos object so that it is initialized, placing the chooser on the dashboard
        Autos
    }

    // Replace with CommandPS4Controller or CommandJoystick if needed
    private val driverController = CommandXboxController(OperatorConstants.DRIVER_CONTROLLER_PORT)
","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":31,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T18:33:26.231Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":45.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":421018,"topic_slug":"intellij-idea-frc-plugin-update-released-for-2023-season","display_username":"Falon Clark","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57393,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The Kotlin Guy"},"post_url":"/t/intellij-idea-frc-plugin-update-released-for-2023-season/421018/17","custom_user_title":"The Kotlin Guy","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3354183,"name":"Javaru","username":"Javaru","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/javaru/{size}/6589_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T19:24:40.326Z","cooked":"

Thanks. I‚Äôll get that fixed. (Bug report in GitLab.)

When I update the templates each year, for testing, I do my best to build a project created by the templates. But I typically do not have the time to also deploy to a roboRIO and try running them to catch runtime issues like this. In the future I‚Äôll try to at least run a project for the primary templates. (And ironically, I have a custom Kotlin Command Based Robot template that I use for our team, so I did not notice this.) Thanks again for letting me know.
